properties.name: onSubmit
properties.description: A function invoked when the user submits his input. Receives the text as a single property. Make sure your page is UTF-8 encoded so Chinese and Emoji are rendered OK.

properties.name: onKeyboardWillShow
properties.description: A function invoked when the keyboard is about to pop up. Receives the height as a single property. (iOS only)

properties.name: onKeyboardDidShow
properties.description: A function invoked when the keyboard popped up. Receives the height as a single property.

properties.name: onKeyboardWillHide
properties.description: A function invoked when the keyboard is about to close. (iOS only)

properties.name: onKeyboardDidHide
properties.description: A function invoked when the keyboard closed.

properties.name: onTextChanged
properties.description: A function invoked when any key is pressed, sends the entire text as response.

properties.name: autoscrollElement
properties.description: Highly recommended to pass in if you want to replicate the behavior of the video's above (scroll down when the keyboard opens). Pass in the scrollable DOM element containing the messages.

properties.name: scrollToBottomAfterMessengerShows
properties.description: If `autoscrollElement` was set you can also make the list scroll down initially, when the messenger bar (without the keyboard popping up) is shown.

properties.name: keepOpenAfterSubmit
properties.description: Setting this to `true` is like the video's above: the keyboard doesn't close upon submit. Defaults to `false`.

properties.name: animated
properties.description: Makes the messenger bar slide in from the bottom. Defaults to `false`.

properties.name: showKeyboard
properties.description: Open the keyboard when showing the messenger. Defaults to `false`.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The default text set in the messenger input bar.

properties.name: textColor
properties.description: The color of the typed text. Defaults to `#444444`.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Like a regular HTML input placeholder.

properties.name: placeholderColor
properties.description: The color of the placeholder text. Defaults to `#CCCCCC`.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: The background color of the messenger bar. Defaults to `#F6F6F6`.

properties.name: textViewBackgroundColor
properties.description: The background color of the textview. Looks nicest on Android if it's the same color as the `backgroundColor` property. Defaults to `#F6F6F6`.

properties.name: textViewBorderColor
properties.description: The border color of the textview. Defaults to `#666666`. (iOS only)

properties.name: maxChars
properties.description: Setting this > 0 will make a counter show up on iOS (and ignore superfluous input on Android, for now)

properties.name: counterStyle
properties.description: Options are: `"none"`, `"split"`, `"countdown"`, `"countdownreversed"`. Note that if `maxChars` is set, `"none"` will still show a counter. Defaults to `"none"`. (iOS only)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Options are: "default", "decimalpad", "phonepad", "numberpad", "namephonepad", "number", "email", "twitter", "url", "alphabet", "search", "ascii". (iOS only)

properties.name: appearance
properties.description: Options are: "light", "dark". (iOS only)

properties.name: secure
properties.description: Disables things like the Emoji keyboard and the Predicive text entry bar (iOS only)
